verbs.description: clacket (third-person singular simple present clackets, present participle clacketing, simple past and past participle clacketed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To move with a clackety sound.
(intransitive, UK, regional) To chatter or prattle.
examples: You'm no better than a baby when they've clacketed at ye for an hour or two without a word of sense from beginnin' to end.
